Who was Martin Luther King Jr. and when and where was he assassinated?

ENDINSTRUCTION

Martin Luther King Jr. was a prominent leader in the Civil Rights Movement in the United States. He was assassinated on April 4, 1968, in Memphis, Tennessee. He was there to support striking sanitation workers who were protesting against poor working conditions and low pay. His death led to an outpouring of anger among black Americans, as well as a period of national mourning that helped speed the way for an equal housing bill that would be the last significant legislative achievement of the civil rights era.
